_description: Ballad of the battle of Crecrynbroghe(?)—thirty 4-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Syck sicke & totowe sike / & sicke & like to die / the sikest nighte that euer I abode / god lord haue mercy on me’

BLCottVesAXXV.First Lines:
It befell at martynmasWhen wether waxid coldeCaptaine care
                    said to his menwe must go take a holde…
BLCottVesAXXV.Last Lines:
…& haue sawed my children threall & my lonesome
                    wyffe
BLCottVesAXXV.Note:
Fol. 179 damaged, only first of two columns preserved; see Reimer (1998)
XReimer,  Stephen R. 
             “The Index of Middle English Verse: Some Corrections and Additions
                towards the Next Edition.” 
             Notes and Queries
         45 [243] (1998): 16-22, 17.
BLCottVesAXXV.Attributed Author: finis per me William Asheton clericum (f. 179)
